intro: Gaultheria nubigena, commonly known as the Andean wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and have a distinctive aromatic scent. Gaultheria nubigena is adapted to cold, nutrient-poor environments and is often found in cloud forests and alpine regions.
